intro: Galarhoeus ibericus, commonly known as the Iberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Galarhoeus ibericus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions.
